attributes.action: Request that the government revoke Govia's contract for Southern Rail
attributes.background:
Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Stop the total smoking ban in psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Legislation comes into force in NHS psychiatric hospitals on 1st October 2016.  Smoking is already limited to certain areas and at certain times so those who do not smoke are not adversely affected.  The last thing distressed people need is to have their de-stressing mechanism denied them.
attributes.additional_details: I have a relative who is on her 3rd "episode", hence another lengthy stay on a mental health ward.  New arrivals to a ward are already under stress.  I am not a smoker myself but I see many patients desperate for the next smoking break to help them relax.  Who will have to deal with this extra agitation?  Staff who are already under pressure.  The legislation may be well intentioned but I think it is totally wrong to impose a smoking ban on patients who are locked up and whose "home" is the ward

attributes.action: The UK parliament should close down this petition website.
attributes.background: The UK parliament should close down this petition website. It is being used by the vocal minority to pursue debates on niche issues that do not concern the British public as a whole.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for building companies to have indemnity insurance
attributes.background: This is to protect consumers against rogue traders, not finishing work, doing incorrect and unsafe work then closing that business down and the consumer unable to claim  any monies back from the builder. This way consumers could then claim against their insurance.

attributes.action: Work with governments in other countries to take action against child soldiers
attributes.background:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou
attributes.additional_details:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against. 
 We decided child soldiers as children younger than us are being kidnapped and forced to become soldiers. This is something we feel strongly and passionate about as it is something that affects children and their lives. #ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Consider all children when calculating Child Maintenance payments.
attributes.background: If you have 2 or more children, your eldest starts university. The student loan they receive is based on YOUR income. The Child Maintenance for your other children goes up as your eldest is not taken into account. So you end up paying considerably more.
attributes.additional_details: The Student loans are means tested from 2016. The Child Maintenance guidelines are 23 years old and do not include young adults at University that as a result of last years change need your support if you earn an average salary. Because under the 23 year old rules, you are now just paying for one child, your payments go up with no account of your other child being taken into account. In my case the extra payments I am being asked for plus the what I have to give my eldest to live is actually £250 extra a month. I wish common sense would prevail. Thanks you for reading, I hope you sign.

attributes.action: Provide parents with a death certificate for the loss of any confirmed pregnancy
attributes.background:
The parents of every confirmed miscarriage, before the viability age of 24 weeks, should have the option to a certificate of death.

I honestly believe this small change could massively help with the grieving process of many mother and fathers that sadly lose their babies so early.
attributes.additional_details:
I suffered an early miscarriage before the stage of a first scan. The only thing we have from our baby is pictures of positive tests. It would have brought us so much comfort just to have something to prove that our baby existed.

Some mothers have to give birth to their perfectly formed child. There is then no paper proof of their baby existing. 
No matter what stage of pregnancy, these babies are loved and a loss is a massively traumatic experience. Something so easy could help ease this pain.

attributes.action: Make PIP more accessible to people with rare illnesses
attributes.background: I have suffered from Guillain Barre Syndrome for five years. I have pins and needles in my feet which make it very painful to walk, and muscle weakness and pains in my arms. I am currently waiting a decision from the Upper Tribunal. There are many other people out there in the same position.
attributes.additional_details: There are approximately 1 in every 200,000 get GBS and 20% of these have some form of residual issues. I returned to work because I wanted to try and get back to normal. This hasn't happened and I had to became part-time. I only work two days at a time because I get too tired. I have to get taxi's when I go anywhere because I am unable to use public transport unless someone is with me. Nerve damage means I will not recover. Disabled people need your help.

attributes.action: Make work experience a compulsory part of the Yr 9 and Yr 11 curriculum again.
attributes.background: We are being made to make choices that may shape our entire career without having been given the opportunity to experience a working environment.  If work experience was compulsory we could experience different types of jobs and make informed choices about what qualifications we wanted to pursue.
attributes.additional_details: If 2 opportunities were given in Yr 9 and Yr 11 to undertake 2 weeks of work experience young people would be able to make better informed GCSE and A Level choices.  It would also allow them the opportunity to build their character by recognising what key skills they may need to develop further.  It also allows them potential segues into jobs when they reach school leaving age.  This opportunity for personal development should be just as essential as the rest of the curriculum.

attributes.action: Teach about lesbian-specific protection in schools.
attributes.background: While every school teaches students to use a condom to protect from pregnancy and STI's, very few even mention lesbian-specific protection.  Young women should be formally educated on the risks they face when engaging in same-sex sexual activities and how best to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details:
I was shocked to learn at the age of eighteen (two years after the age whereby one can consent to having sex) that lesbian-specific protection exists. 

From asking people on my social media, only 18/100 people were taught about this protection in school, while 32/100 knew it existed.  

There is a call for homosexual sex-ed lessons in schools, but lesbian protection should be taught as a priority as a matter of promoting safe sex.  Everyone should know how to protect themselves and stay safe.

attributes.action: Do not stop PSA Prostate Specific Antigen tests for men.
attributes.background: I have have suffered prostate cancer and had a prostatectomy. The issue was highlighted following a blood test for PSA. I had no symptoms, don't smoke or drink and keep fit
attributes.additional_details:
It was the my manager who encouraged me to go for a test following a friend suffering the disease. Had I not had the test I would now be in the advanced stages of cancer and do not know how long I would have to live. 
Further to this I know of three other men with the same story.
If this is stopped men will die.PSA test will show your individual PSA level and enable you monitor of your reading. Its a simple blood test and nothing more.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available on the NHS
attributes.background: According to a Huffington Post article women spend £6000 on sanitary products in a lifetime.Providing menstrual cups on the NHS would save women thousands. As they are reuseable it not only provides a good solution for the costly issues but also the environmental issues that sanitary products create
attributes.additional_details: Women on average use around 11,000 disposable sanitary products in a lifetime, which end up in a landfill or the sea. The time it takes for a tampon or pad to degrade in landfills is centuries, particularly when wrapped in a plastic bag. Ocean Conservancy volunteers collected 27,938 used tampons and applicators on our world’s beaches on a single day (International Coastal Cleanup, 2013). Since a menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years, using one would prevent a decade's worth of waste.

attributes.action: Abolish the pay to stay proposals in the current housing bill.
attributes.background: The pay to stay policy is part of the current Housing Bill that is going through parliament. This policy will mean social housing tenants who's household income exceeds £30,000 (£40,000 in London) will be required to pay market rents for their home. This will have a devastating affect on families.
attributes.additional_details: There are several articles circulating with people's stories and how it will affect them. I believe the threshold is far too low, as a family earning £3/40,000 a year would not be able to buy a home on this income. Moreover, there are no controls on the current market so prices are ridiculously high. Families will split to avoid exceeding the threshold or the stress/strain of paying 150% more in rent. This policy will make people homeless or push 1000s into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children
attributes.background: In London 11 to 15 year olds currently get free travel. This should be available to all children nationally and the law should be changed to require bus companies to offer free travel to children nationally. This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Enforce tougher penalties for mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.background: While driving around the country with work, I witness far too many drivers all over the road because they are using their mobile phones, mainly in their hands, while driving. This is mostly texting or typing. The current fine and penalty points are far too low and the penalty must be higher.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who text on the road are in far more danger than intoxicated drivers.

A Techtimes study results show those who occupied themselves with text messages, either by reading or writing them, had slower reactions times by 35%. By comparison, drunk drivers displayed a 12% decrease in reaction time, while drivers intoxicated with cannabis had slowed response times by 21%. http://www.techtimes.com/articles/8185/20140609/texting-is-more-dangerous-than-drugs-alcohol-while-driving-study.htm

attributes.action: Change school hours to 9am - 4pm everywhere in the U.K.
attributes.background:
I want action to take place because as an 18-year-old, I understand how majority of students feel about the pressure of getting to school on time.

I love education and learning but to be threatened to get kicked out because I'm late by a couple of minutes shouldn't be an excuse to stop me.
attributes.additional_details:
As a teenager, I asked my peers at Bacon's College what they would prefer, school to start at the times it is already at or 9am - 4pm. 98.7% of my peers agreed that it should start later because of the fact that they are always tired in the morning and can never concentrate properly.

Biologically speaking, teenagers don't have good focus or attention until after 10am, this evidence can be read about in this BBC article: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-34192371. 

Schools in countries such as Finland are performing better and they don't give their students homework nor do they start school as early as us. You can find this proof anywhere on the internet.

attributes.action: Help from the NHS to provide more mental health support for people aged 16-18.
attributes.background: The NHS have many adolescent services but long waiting lists mean that support is unavailable when people most critically need it. When people reach 17, they no longer fit the criteria for an adolescent patient, but don't fit in the age range for adult services, so they are left without support.
attributes.additional_details: Being left to find private services at the age of 17 can be very difficult for families as a result of the very high prices. The cost of services can prevent these people from getting the support they need. This time without care can be very detrimental to a young person with poor mental health, so therefore the gap between adolescent and adult services needs to be filled.

attributes.action: Defer invocation of Article 50 until DJ Trump and M Pence have left office.
attributes.background: At a time of unprecented instability in the United States of America we need to stand shoulder to shoulder with our European allies in order to promote and maintain global stability and democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: Invoking article 50 is likely to destabilise our economy at a time of heightened global threat. Leaving the EU at this time will render us highly dependent on the United States of America. Under the leadership of Donald Trump and/or Mike Pence we cannot assume that our national interest will be best served by this alliance.

attributes.action: Lower the amount of signatures needed for discussion in parliament to 25000
attributes.background: The minimum signatures required for discussion in parliament is too high at 100,000

attributes.action: Fathers to have 50/50 rights and stricter penalties for breach of court order
attributes.background: I want fathers to have equal rights in a family court and not just automatically given to the mother. Also a stronger penalty for breach of court order. With the person who is breachig the court order liable to pay costs towards a new court order.
attributes.additional_details:
Time and time again fathers are being stopped from seeing their children. Even with a visitation order, the ex partner can stop them and have to be taken back to court at the expense of the father again. 

It's a lengthy and costly process and the mother has automatic residency rights over the child. The current procedures don't do enough to stop a mother from blocking contact with their children. 

If the mother blocks contact without a valid excuse, she should be made to pay future court fees

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Give all airfields statutory protection as Valuable Habitats for flora & fauna
attributes.background:
Airfields are under threat for development for housing
Airfields provide havens for flora and fauna as they are never ploughed or sprayed with chemicals - occasional aircraft movement has little effect on plants animals & reptiles
Airfields provide an open space amenity for local people
attributes.additional_details: Airfields are being closed by developers destroying significant areas of natural habitat within airfield boundaries. All airfields should be reclassified as "Valuable Habitats" and given protected status to save rare plants, animals, reptiles, insects and invertebrates under The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2010

attributes.action: Public inquiry into the death of Mogous Abay
attributes.background: We the undersigned consider the conduct and investigation in to the death of Mogous Abay as being riddled with inconsistencies and incompetence. We therefore call for a public inquiry into his death.
attributes.additional_details: Since 1990 there has been no serious police investigation into the death of Mogous Abay. The circumstances leading to his death are considered to be suspicious and the handling of the case by the police highlights inconsistencies. The police assumed that Mogous had committed suicide by throwing himself from the fourth floor of his flat in London. Contrary to police reports several witnesses have signed statements insisting that Mogous had come to his death before the event of a fall.

attributes.action: Make Statutory Maternity Pay 90% of average weekly earnings for 39 weeks
attributes.background: My husband and I are parents to a wonderful little girl named Daisy. We would love to have another child. Unfortunately, we know we will never be able to afford it with maternity pay being so low, i.e. £139.58 a week or less. Please support working parents
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment, statutory maternity pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get: 
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks 
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies increasing prices after a non-fault accident.
attributes.background: Currently, insurers can charge more for customers who have been involved in a non- fault accident in the past 5 years. As an 18 year old, I was involved in one and my insurance costs went up by 20% as a result. I fail to see why people who are not at fault for an accident should be punished for it.

attributes.action: Reduction of tuition fees to £6,000 per annum
attributes.background: We spend most of our youth in school, to then spend the rest of our lives paying it off. Lowering the fees provides greater opportunities to educate more of our society and potentially help the disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Upon leaving the EU, immediately pay £350 million per week to the NHS.
attributes.background: It is widely held that to ignore the Referendum vote  would be a dereliction of democracy. Equally derelict would be to ignore the rest of the deal, garishly displayed on the Leavers' bus. To respect part of the deal and to ignore the rest is fraudulent. We want hypothecated inflation-adjusted funds
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=the+leave+bus&biw=1366&bih=565&tbm=isch&imgil=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%253BAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.itv.com%25252Fnews%25252Fwestcountry%25252Fstory%25252F2016-05-11%25252Feu-referendum-vote-leave-campaign-gets-underway-in-cornwall%25252F&source=iu&pf=m&fir=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%252CAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%252C_&usg=__pVjQA6MrJ7G5fZBt4Ff6UawN9_E%3D&ved=0ahUKEwjLjua7o_bRAhVQF8AKHfc5BmUQyjcIJQ&ei=zLKVWMt40K6ABvfzmKgG#imgrc=Jr4HD7qgUDrKKM:

attributes.action: Stop The Franco-British military pact as it was not debated in Parliament
attributes.background: The Franco-British military pact was not debated in Parliament and the public was not invited to debate the issue. This pact was set up by David Cameron in 2010.

attributes.action: Do not cut the number of visas for international students coming to the UK.
attributes.background: The Home office is considering plans to cut the number of visas granted to overseas students by nearly half, slashing the current 300,000 to 170,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Besides denying students an opportunity to study at UK universities, this move will cost the UK economy (Universities UK puts non-EU student contributions to UK GDP at £9b in 2014-15). In short this is a lose-lose measure. Students lose out. The UK loses out. And the government gains nothing substantive in its efforts to reach Conservative manifesto migration targets.

attributes.action: Demand for animals play toys to pass a safety check
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Service charges & tips should be given to staff automatically by law
attributes.background:
The TV chef Michel Roux Jr has admitted his Michelin-starred Le Gavroche restaurant keeps 100% of the service charge added to bills instead of distributing the cash to staff in addition to their pay.

The government ran a consultation this summer but no law has been passed so far.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: Parliamentary Candidates must have lived in the seat for 2 years before standing
attributes.background: I find it undemocratic that Parliamentary Candidates can stand with no history or knowledge whatsoever of the seat, whereas you must be on the Electoral roll or live in the ward for local elections.
attributes.additional_details:
Here in North Dorset we had a very able local hopeful for the Tories, however the candidate selected was from the PM;s home town of Witney, having stood in the previous election in Cardiff.
This is the Westminster bubble in action.

attributes.action: Reduce the annual income for a spousal visa to be in line with living wage
attributes.background:
The spousal visa requirement means that I must be earning £18,600 a year (and increases with dependents) To even be consider for the visa means that most people cannot afford to be in love.
I myself work two well paid jobs and still don't meet the criteria. This means my husband cannot join me.
attributes.additional_details:
The visa requirement would be much fairer for all if it was in line with the living wage and would stop the separation of 43% of family's.

This requirement has been a problem for many families for a long time and something needs to change. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/feb/21/families-challenge-minimum-income-visa-rules-supreme-court-non-eu-partner 

There should not be a price to pay for being happy and in love.

attributes.action: Owners of UK media should be registered to vote and pay taxes within the UK.
attributes.background: Our democracy requires balanced and accountable news media. Part of the 'fit and proper person' test for owning a significant portion of our media should be that they are eligible to vote and pay taxes, so that they, like the rest of us, are fully part of the political environment they help shape.

attributes.action: Get the NHS to recognise 'visual snow' an illness affecting thousands.
attributes.background: Visual snow means seeing what looks like static everywhere in your vision, its neurological and not a mental health illness. But unrecognised hence the name 'visual snow'. Thousands of people suffer with it and it's being ignored. Something needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details: 'Visual snow, visual static, or persistent visual snow is a transitory or persisting medical disorder in which sufferers see snow or television-like static in parts or the whole of their visual fields, constantly in all light conditions, even visible in daylight, darkness and with closed eyelids'

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Keep the ban on building new Grammars and keep the Comprehensive school system.
attributes.background: Theresa May has said she wants to bring back grammars this could take away opportunities for people like me who have learning difficulties as well as bring in a class divide because of tutors to help kids pass the test pricing others out.

attributes.action: Introduce tax on disposable coffee cups to reduce waste
attributes.background:
2,500,000,000 disposable coffee cups are thrown away in the UK each year. 

1 in 400 are recycled. The coffee industry and chains are NOT doing enough voluntarily to reduce waste. The tax for plastic bags worked-use fell massively. Let's consider the environment and do the same with coffee cups.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to start reducing our waste now before it is too late.

100,000 trees are used for the cups each year: 
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/oct/05/uks-billions-of-takeaway-cups-could-each-take-30-years-to-break-down

Ministers reject coffee cup tax despite massive wastage: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/oct/31/ministers-reject-calls-for-charge-on-disposable-coffee-cups

Plastic bag reductions: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36917174

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for cinemas to provide access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.background:
1 in 6 people in the UK have some form of hearing loss or deafness, this accounts for 11 million people, with over 900,000 having a severe or profound deafness. 

Fewer than 1% of cinema screening are currently subtitled, we would like to see an increase in access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details:
On January 17th 2017, it becomes mandatory for all cinemas showing digital films within the United States of America to provide closed-caption personal subtitling devices at every showing. This means that open screen subtitling, which is infrequently programmed, isn't the only option for patrons with hearing loss. 

We believe that the UK should follow suit and provide proper access to those with hearing loss that wish to access the cinema.

attributes.action: Ensure Gender Inequality is taught as part of secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: Our aim is to spread awareness of the impact in which these subtle but meaningful gender stereotypes impact on women, men and children in society unwittingly. Promote high self esteem as well as to recognize the impact these portrayals have on different people.

attributes.action: Mandatory dog bite prevention in the school and preschool curriculum
attributes.background: It has become apparent with recent tragic events the current system does not stop or decrease dog bites and hospitalisation . I feel education in dog handling and bite prevention is a key area in tackling dog bites as the largest demographic is young children , many bites can be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
Bite statistics rise every year . Far too much blame is put on the breed of dog luring many owners of other breeds into a false sense of security . Many of the worlds top trainers and behaviourists such as victoria stillwell , jo rosie , nando brown , cesar millan all disagree with breed specific legislation and promote bite prevention , education and responsible dog ownership. Nearly all dog bites are preventable . 
Lets teach our children how to be safe around dogs!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of honey in order to fight the decline in bee populations
attributes.background: The impact that the honey industry has on bee populations is detrimental - by taking away their honey, we are depriving them of their ability to feed their young and to insulate their hives. We demand a total ban on the sale of honey in the UK to help protect our bees from extinction.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, there has been lots of media coverage surrounding the decline in bee populations. It is no secret that if bees go extinct, we are only a couple of years behind.
Bees produce honey for two reasons – to feed their young, and to insulate their hives, therefore by taking their honey from them we are depriving them of their ability to carry out these essential survival functions. It is vital that we stop this practice for the bees' sake, for our sake and for the sake of our planet.

attributes.action: Require Councillors to acknowledge conflict of interest
attributes.background: A recent series of developments in my city have been widely supported by a councilor, with suggested family ties to a prominent ties to a large property developer. If true this is a conflict of interests and should be acknowledged and prevented.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate a motion of no confidence in the current British Government
attributes.background: The recent foreign policy moves to remove the UK from the EU regardless of the damage it will do and the invite of Donald Trump to come to the UK on a State Visit  indicates a government that acts without care or diligence and is losing the confidence of much of the electorate each passing day.
attributes.additional_details: Much of the decisions being made by the current government appear disjointed, taken purely for short term reasons and to please only a portion of the electorate rather than for the greater good of all of the citizens of the four nations of these islands. The hasty invite to Donald Trump to meet the Queen now points to a government with an overall agenda that is ill-conceived. As such they are not fit to govern and a general election should be called.

attributes.action: Legalize CBD oil for medical use.
attributes.background: If it wasn't for CBD Oil I would still be in hospital. I've recently recovered from brain tumour surgery and CBD oil has helped me to bounce back without taking any of the pain meds given to me by doctors. CBD oil is giving me my life back slowly.
attributes.additional_details: I am setting up this petition to get CBD legalized for medical reasons, and I believe it should be given to people with many different health problems.
